setting.label: Local IP address
setting.help_text: Enter the IP address of this machine. Use an externally accessible address (ie, not 127.0.0.1) if you are going to be running a frontend on a different machine than this one.
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend IP address

setting.label: Local IPv6 address
setting.help_text: Enter the IP address of this machine. Use an externally accessible address (ie, not ::1) if you are going to be running a frontend on a different machine than this one.
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend IPv6 address

setting.label: Port
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend server port
setting.help_text: Unless you've got good reason, don't change this.

setting.label: Status port
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend status port
setting.help_text: Port on which the server will listen for HTTP requests, including backend status and MythXML requests.

setting.label: Security PIN (required)
setting.placeholder_text: Enter security PIN code

setting.label: Master backend IP address
setting.placeholder_text: Enter master server IP address
setting.help_text: The IP address of the master backend server. All frontend and non-master backend machines will connect to this server. If you only have one backend, this should be the same IP address as above.

setting.label: Port
setting.help_text: Unless you've got good reason, don't change this.

setting.label: TV format
setting.help_text: The TV standard to use for viewing TV.

setting.label: VBI format
setting.help_text: The VBI (Vertical Blanking Interval) is used to carry Teletext or Closed Captioning data.

setting.label: Channel frequency table
setting.help_text: Select the appropriate frequency table for your system. If you have an antenna, use a '-bcast' frequency.

setting.label: Your local time zone (for XMLTV)
setting.help_text: Used if the XMLTV data comes from a different time zone than your own and modifies the date and time before insertion into the database. 'Auto' converts the XMLTV time to local time using your computer's time zone. 'None' ignores the XMLTV timezone, interpreting times as local.

setting.label: Master backend override
setting.help_text: If enabled, the master backend will stream and delete files if it finds them in a storage directory. Useful if you are using a central storage location, like a NFS share, and your slave backend isn't running.

setting.label: Follow symbolic links when deleting files
setting.help_text: If enabled, MythTV will follow symlinks when recordings and related files are deleted, instead of deleting the symlink and leaving the actual file.

setting.label: Delete files slowly
setting.help_text: Some filesystems use a lot of resources when deleting large files. If enabled, this option makes MythTV delete files slowly on this backend to lessen the impact.

setting.label: Storage Group disk scheduler
setting.help_text: This setting controls how the Storage Group scheduling code will balance new recordings across directories. 'Balanced Free Space' is the recommended method for most users.

setting.label: Miscellaneous status application
setting.placeholder_text: Enter miscellaneous status command
setting.help_text: External application or script that outputs extra information for inclusion in the backend status page. See http://www.mythtv.org/wiki/Miscellaneous_Status_Information

setting.label: Disable automatic database backup
setting.help_text: If enabled, MythTV will not backup the database before upgrades. You should therefore have your own database backup strategy in place.

setting.label: Disable FireWire reset
setting.help_text: By default, MythTV resets the FireWire bus when a FireWire recorder stops responding to commands. If this causes problems, you can disable this behavior here.

setting.label: Backend idle before EIT crawl (seconds)
setting.help_text: The minimum number of seconds after a recorder becomes idle to wait before MythTV begins collecting EIT listings data.

setting.label: Startup command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter startup command
setting.help_text: This command is executed right after starting the BE. As a parameter \'$status\' is replaced by either \'auto\' if the machine was started automatically or \'user\' if a user switched it on.

setting.label: Block shutdown before client connected
setting.help_text: If enabled, the automatic shutdown routine will be disabled until a client connects.

setting.label: Idle shutdown timeout (seconds)
setting.help_text: The amount of time the master backend idles before it shuts down all other backends. Set to 'Disabled' to disable automatic shutdown.

setting.label: Max. wait for recording (minutes)
setting.help_text: The number of minutes the master backend waits for a recording. If the backend is idle but a recording starts within this time period, it won't shut down.

setting.label: Startup before recording (seconds)
setting.help_text: The number of seconds the master backend will be woken up before a recording starts.

setting.label: Wakeup time format
setting.placeholder_text: Enter wakeup time format
setting.help_text: The format of the time string passed to the 'Command to set wakeup time' as $time. See QT::QDateTime.toString() for details. Set to 'time_t' for seconds since epoch.

setting.label: Command to set wakeup time
setting.placeholder_text: Enter wakeup time command
setting.help_text: The command used to set the wakeup time (passed as $time) for the master backend

setting.label: Server halt command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend halt command
setting.help_text: The command used to halt the backends.

setting.label: Pre-shutdown-check command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter pre-shutdown-check command
setting.help_text: A command executed before the backend would shutdown. The return value determines if the backend can shutdown. 0 - yes, 1 - restart idling, 2 - reset the backend to wait for a frontend.

setting.label: Delay between wake attempts (seconds)
setting.help_text: Length of time the frontend waits between tries to wake up the master backend. This should be the time your master backend needs to startup. Set to 'Disabled' to disable.

setting.label: Wake attempts
setting.help_text: Number of times the frontend will try to wake up the master backend.

setting.label: Wake command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter Wake command
setting.help_text: The command used to wake up your master backend server. For example, 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend restart'.

setting.label: Sleep command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter sleep command
setting.help_text: The command used to put this slave to sleep. If set, the master backend will use this command to put this slave to sleep when it is not needed for recording.

setting.label: Wake command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter wake command
setting.help_text: The command used to wake up this slave from sleep. This setting is not used on the master backend.

setting.label: Backend stop command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend stop command
setting.help_text: The command used to stop the backend when running on the master backend server. For example, 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend stop'.

setting.label: Backend start command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend start command
setting.help_text: The command used to start the backend when running on the master backend server. For example, 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend start'.

setting.label: Maximum simultaneous jobs on this backend
setting.help_text: The Job Queue will be limited to running this many simultaneous jobs on this backend.

setting.label: Job Queue check frequency (seconds)
setting.help_text: When looking for new jobs to process, the Job Queue will wait this many seconds between checks.

setting.label: Job Queue start time
setting.help_text: This setting controls the start of the Job Queue time window, which determines when new jobs will be started.

setting.label: Job Queue end time
setting.help_text: This setting controls the end of the Job Queue time window, which determines when new jobs will be started.

setting.label: CPU usage
setting.help_text: This setting controls approximately how much CPU jobs in the queue may consume. On 'High', all available CPU time may be used, which could cause problems on slower systems.

setting.label: Allow metadata lookup jobs
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow metadata lookup jobs to run on this backend. Metadata lookup jobs add information like season and episode to completed recordings.

setting.label: Allow commercial-detection jobs
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow transcoding jobs
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow user job #1 on this backend
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow user job #2 on this backend
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow user job #3 on this backend
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow user job #4 on this backend
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Run jobs only on original recording backend
setting.help_text: If enabled, jobs in the queue will be required to run on the backend that made the original recording.

setting.label: Start auto-commercial-detection jobs when the recording starts
setting.help_text: If enabled and automatic commercial detection is ON for a recording, the job will be started as soon as the recording starts. Not recommended on underpowered systems.

setting.label: Commercial-detection command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter commercial-detection command
setting.help_text: The program used to detect commercials in a recording. The default is 'mythcommflag' if this setting is empty.

setting.label: Transcoder command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter transcoder command
setting.help_text: The program used to transcode recordings. The default is 'mythtranscode' if this setting is empty.

setting.label: Run transcode jobs before auto commercial detection
setting.help_text: If enabled, and if both auto-transcode and auto commercial detection are turned on for a recording, transcoding will run first; otherwise, commercial detection runs first.

setting.label: Save original files after transcoding (globally)
setting.help_text: If enabled and the transcoder is active, the original files will be renamed to .old once the transcoding is complete.

setting.label: Guide data program
setting.placeholder_text: Enter guide data command
setting.help_text: Use 'mythfilldatabase' or the name of a custom script that will populate the program guide info for all your video sources.

setting.label: Guide data arguments
setting.placeholder_text: Enter guide data program arguments
setting.help_text: Any arguments you want passed to the guide data program.

setting.label: Guide data program execution start
setting.help_text: This setting and the following one define a time period when the guide data program is allowed to run. For example, setting start to 11 and end to 13 would mean that the program would only run between 11:00 AM and 1:59 PM.

setting.label: Guide data program execution end
setting.help_text: This setting and the preceding one define a time period when the guide data program is allowed to run. For example, setting start to 11 and end to 13 would mean that the program would only run between 11:00 AM and 1:59 PM.

setting.label: Run guide data program at time suggested by the grabber.
setting.help_text: If enabled, allow a DataDirect guide data provider to specify the next download time in order to distribute load on their servers. Guide data program execution start/end times are also ignored.
